More info and better images of [BUGATTI](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074547/http:/www.cartype.com/page.cfm?id=152&alph=ALL)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074547im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bugatti_2_6370.jpg)
And at least two different eps versions available [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074547/http:/brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=9585324&page=1&mtype=&brand_id=77455).
Vintage logos are more often than not custom designed/hand drawn.

\> _custom designed/hand drawn_

More than likely based on a European foundry's Gothic.  
The closest digital face I could find is Red Rooster [Gothic Medium Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074547/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/gothic-rr/), which was based on a old Ludlow design.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074547im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Gothic_Med_cond_5910.png)
